Articles.Content:
Hey, so I recently got 0.90.0.705, running mac OSX 10.10.1 and in any folder I unzipp, after a while, (serveral launches/contracts) all the menu elements become unresponsive ingame, and stay that way anytime the game is loaded from that file afterwards.

What this means is, although they detect the mouse hovering, they don't allow interaction.

The buttons that don't work include:

Entering the SPH/VAB.

Leaving (but NOT entering) the Mission Control and Astronaut buildings.

The "Quit to main menu" button in the pause menu. (but not the resume game or settings button)

The "Return to space centre" button in the pause menu and at the top of the screen, as well as the "recover vessel" button.

Despite this, the main menu of the game seems completely normal even after the bug has occurred.

Quitting KSP does not fix it, but unzipping and re-launching does temporarily.

Thanks for any help!

edit: KSP.log is here: http://txs.io/8Wub

Edited December 16, 2014 by exegesis

This is caused by one of the new Fine Print contracts.

Whenever that contract (not sure which) is either active, or even just in the list of available missions, the UI controls will softlock after flight.
The problem also occurs on Windows, as my game has the same bug.

In my case, it was this sequence inside save file.

I did 2 cerbal rescue mission missions. When I finished second, the first one cause problem.

After I erase this, the game return to normal.

CONTRACT_FINISHED

{

guid = 35034084-74f9-44ca-b62c-801c4988d89c

type = RescueKerbal

prestige = 1

seed = -1084535038

state = Completed

agent = Research & Development Department

deadlineType = Floating

expiryType = Floating

values = 64800,46008000,11250,45000,11250,0,22,50,105273.286436801,46519.1690084346,46054519.1690084,107677.443606142

body = 1

kerbalName = Logel Kerman

PARAM

{

name = BoardAnyVessel

id = Board

enabled = False

state = Complete

values = 0,0,0,0,0

title = Get Logel Kerman aboard a vessel

failOn = Any

winOn = All

}

PARAM

{

name = RecoverKerbal

id = Recover

enabled = False

state = Complete

values = 0,0,0,0,0

title = Return Home and Recover Logel Kerman

failOn = All

winOn = All

}

}

Did you fire either of the kerbals you rescued? That's a known issue with these kinds of contracts.

See here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105651-KSC-Buildings-Lock-Up-Can-t-Click-on-Anything-Firing-Kerbal-Crashes-Game
